body:
As just discussed with @waseem, one could apply a similar approach to the [following based on EpicFail](https://github.com/bsodmike/EpicFail/blob/master/lib/epic_fail/exceptions/rack.rb):

```ruby
module EpicFail
  module Exceptions
    class Rack
      #...
      
      def notify_exception(e, env)
        # Exception: backtrace  exception  message
        EpicFail::Failure.create!(:exception => "#{e.class}", :message => "#{e.message}", :backtrace => "#{e.backtrace}")
      end
    end
  end
end
```

and perform

```ruby
ActiveRecord::Migrator.current_version != (ActiveRecord::Migrator.migrations(migrations_paths).last.try(:version)||0)
```

to detect a pending migration.  `e.message` can be updated accordingly and presented in the rendered error.  All of the above as per @jonleighton still apply.  Thoughts?
